com.polarion.platform.security

Interface ISecurityService


  • public interface ISecurityService
    The entry point for authentication and authorization tasks. The ISecurityService manages the users, roles and their relationships and permissions and their relationship to users and roles.
    Author:
    dobisekm

        See Also:

      • getSubjectCredentials

        IUserCredentials getSubjectCredentials(javax.security.auth.Subject subj,
                                       java.lang.String credentialsKey)
        Returns the credentials of the logged-in user. This method is meant for interaction with other systems, like SVN.
        Parameters:
        credentialsKey - This is a string identification of the target system. This is preparation for setups, where one user will have different set of credentials for different resources (e.g. for different SVN repositories). If the key is not recognized or is null, then the default credentials are returned.
        Returns:
        the credentials or null if no user is logged

      • authenticate

        void authenticate(@NotNull
                  java.lang.String userName,
                  @Nullable
                  java.lang.String password,
                  @NotNull
                  java.lang.String source)
           throws AuthenticationFailedException
        Verifies the provided user's credentials, but does not log them in.
        Parameters:
        userName -
        password -
        source - the authentication source, (e.g. "portal/IP" or "system"), used for writing to logs.
        Throws:
        AuthenticationFailedException - if the provided credentials are invalid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if userName or source are null
        Since:
        3.17.0

      • login

        javax.security.auth.Subject login(java.lang.String userName,
                                  java.lang.String password,
                                  java.lang.String source)
                           throws AuthenticationFailedException
        Checks the given credentials and creates the Subject representing logged in user. Such subject can be then used as parameter to other methods.
        Parameters:
        userName -
        password -
        source - the login source (e.g. "portal/IP" or "system"), used only for writing to logs.
        Returns:
        authenticated subject (not null)
        Throws:
        AuthenticationFailedException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if userName or source are null

      • loginWithToken

        @NotNull
javax.security.auth.Subject loginWithToken(@NotNull
                                                    java.lang.String token,
                                                    @NotNull
                                                    java.lang.String source)
                                             throws AuthenticationFailedException
        Checks the given token using the underlying security mechanism and creates the Subject representing the logged in user. This subject can then be used as a parameter to other methods.

        To have Teamcenter Security Services (TCSS) login with a token, you need to first use the following method to create a Base64 encoded token TcssToken.create(String, String).

        Alternatively, to use Kerberos/SPNEGO to login, you need to encode a token into Base64 and then pass it directly.

        Parameters:
        token - the Token used for validation. Cannot be null. The token must be encoded using the Base64 encoding scheme.
        source - the login source (e.g. "portal/IP" or "system"), used only for writing to logs.
        Returns:
        the authenticated subject (not null).
        Throws:
        AuthenticationFailedException - If the given token is not valid.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the mechanism, token or the source are null.
        Since:
        3.17.0

      • loginUserFromVault

        javax.security.auth.Subject loginUserFromVault(java.lang.String userVaultKey,
                                               java.lang.String source)
                                        throws AuthenticationFailedException
        Checks the given credentials and creates the Subject representing logged in user. Such subject can be then used as parameter to other methods.
        Parameters:
        userVaultKey -
        source - the login source (e.g. "portal/IP" or "system"), used only for writing to logs.
        Returns:
        authenticated subject (not null)
        Throws:
        AuthenticationFailedException
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if userName or source are null
        Since:
        3.5.2

      • getGlobalRoles

      • createGlobalRole

        void createGlobalRole(java.lang.String roleId)
        Creates global role. Does nothing if role already exists.
        Parameters:
        roleId -

      • removeGlobalRole

        void removeGlobalRole(java.lang.String roleId)
        Removes global role. Does nothing, if no such role exists.

        Roles 'admin' and 'user' can't be removed, method returns without doing any action in such a case.

        Parameters:
        roleId -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if roleId is null.

      • getContextRoles

        java.util.Collection getContextRoles(IContextId ctx)
        Parameters:
        ctx -
        Returns:
        The immutable Collection of role Ids, which exist in the given context.

      • createContextRole

        void createContextRole(java.lang.String roleId,
                       IContextId ctx)
        Creates context role. Does nothing if role already exists.

        Context role will exist in the given context and the whole context tree below.

        Parameters:
        roleId -

      • removeContextRole

        void removeContextRole(java.lang.String roleId,
                       IContextId ctx)
        Removes global role. Does nothing, if no such role exists.

        Note, that the existence of context role might be inherited from the parent context. In such case, the deletion in current context might have no impact.

        Parameters:
        roleId -
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if roleId is null.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Collection of Strins. Returns empty collection for unknown role. Never returns null.

      • synchronizeBackendSecurity

        ISecurityService.IBackendSecuritySynchronizationResult synchronizeBackendSecurity(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> users,
                                                                                  java.util.Collection<IContextId> contexts)
        Synchronizes backend's (i.e. repository's) security with current state.

        Actual behaviour is implementation-dependent.

        Parameters:
        users - names of users to be synchronized (not null)
        contexts - ids of contexts to be synchronized (not null)
        Returns:
        result of synchronization (not null)
        Since:
        3.1.1
